column4: hello, can someone help me to transfer some files from xubuntu to xp from network, i have been trying from tutorials but i am a bit confused
easy way is use ssh and the winscp client.
these are stuff i download with synaptic?
i think ya shoudl  ask about what exactly you are trying to do then....
in my home network how do i know the name of the server to connect winscp to xubuntuu?
use its ip# is what i do
ifconfig will show the ip#
it is not working, what is this sshf i just installed in linux, do i have to use this?
never used sshfs - Its highly likely that vista's firewall is blocking stuff. try disabling it for a while as a test.
sshfs lets your linux box mount ssh  'connections' as if they were partitions. Not what you need I belive.
the firewall is disabled, i dont need to do nothing on linux, just run winscp should work?
you do have ssh installed on the linux box?
i think ya need to have the openssh package installed and started
ok ill do that
i need the openssh client or server?
may as well install both.
it is installed, now how do i get ssh to run?
try 'ssh localhost' and see if it works
The authenticity of host 'localhost (127.0.0.1)' can't be established.
yes. and you may want tor ead a few ssh tutorials.
you have reminded me of why i dont want to mess with vista. :)
it is not vista, it is xp, and i juse it because i cant get the software i need no work on linux  yet
ok - earlier i though you said you were on vista.   Hmm ssh still aint working with winscp eh?
i tink its  'sshd start'
